intro: Telanthera echinocephala, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the top of the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Telanthera echinocephala is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
